str2: Wild, fierce. From agros; wild, literally or figuratively.
A wave, surge, billow. From kuo (with young), i.e. Bend, curve); a billow.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: From epi and aphrizo; to foam upon, i.e. to exhibit.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Shame, shamefacedness, shameful deeds. From aischunomai; shame or disgrace.
A wanderer. From planos; a rover, i.e. an erratic teacher.
A star. Probably from the base of stronnumi; a star, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural

str2: Darkness, murkiness, gloom. Akin to the base of nephos; gloom.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
